channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: History Today: When Irpinia earthquake, Italy’s strongest ever, killed more than 2,000
Will Japan’s first woman PM challenge the sumo ring taboo?
Meet Kirill Dmitriev, the controversial Kremlin man behind the Ukraine peace push
Once an ally, now labelled a 'traitor' by Trump: Who is Marjorie Taylor Greene?
This Week in Explainers: How Tejas fighter jet came crashing down during Dubai Air Show
Tejas crash in Dubai: Who was IAF Wing Commander Namansh Syal, the pilot India lost?
MBS’s return to Washington signals a strategic reset in US-Saudi relations
item.description: The Saudi Crown Prince’s first visit to Washington in seven years aimed to align US-Saudi leadership and financial commitments behind a shared vision for Gaza’s future; however, issues still persist

item.title: Malabar exercises show Quad prevails and thrives despite challenges
item.description: For all the pessimism surrounding Quad, the truth is that China’s rise is very real, and its manifestation in the form of an expansionist spree across the Indo-Pacific is a challenge

item.title: Hasina’s sentencing: A staged trial by Yunus regime to cover its own failures
item.description: Instigating internal rifts while manufacturing external hostility may offer a government temporary political cover, but it does nothing for the long-term peace, prosperity, or dignity of Bangladesh

item.title: How seeking democracy in Pakistan is chasing a mirage
item.description: The fact is that the Pakistani elites and scholarly circles have never really cared for constitutional and democratic values

item.title: Isolation of Alliance of Sahel States fuels Islamist insurgency in the region
item.description: The future of the AES depends on how well it tackles governance and security-related challenges, and for that it needs Ecowas as well as the Western world

item.title: Bangladesh follows Pakistan template, targeting Ahmadiyyas after Hindus
item.description: In the journey towards a Sharia-governed state, highly regressive regulations to persecute women and minorities are likely to follow
